# default

**Type Property**

The default time zone for the current app.

## Declaration

```swift
class var `default`: TimeZone { get set }
```

## Discussion

If no [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/default] time zone has been set, the current system time zone is used. If the current system time zone cannot be determined, the GMT time zone is used instead.

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/default] time zone is used by the app for date and time operations. You can set it to cause the app to run as if it were in a different time zone. Setting the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/default] property clears any value that was previously set.

If you access the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/default] class property, assign its value to a variable, and set a new [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/default] time zone, the object stored in the variable doesn’t update to reflect the new [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/default] time zone. Contrast this behavior with that of the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/local] class property, which returns a proxy object that always reflects the current system time zone.

## Working with System Time Zones

- **local**: An object that tracks the current system time zone.
- **system**: The time zone currently used by the system.
- **resetSystemTimeZone()**: Clears any time zone value cached for the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/system] property.
